raytracer.material
Class Material

java.lang.Object
  raytracer.material.Material

public class Material
extends java.lang.Object

Simple Material class with diffuse (Lambertian) and specular (Blinn-Phong) reflection.

Author:
(c) 2009-11 Roland Fraedrich

Field Summary
private  java.awt.Color color
          Diffuse material color.
private  double reflectivity
          Degree of reflectivity in the range of [0, 1], where 1 is a perfect mirror.
private  double shininess
          Shininess factor for the specular highlight, according to the Blinn√êPhong shading model.
 
Constructor Summary
Material(java.awt.Color color)
          Constructor for a diffuse material.
Material(java.awt.Color c, double specularShininess)
          Constructor for a specular material.
Material(java.awt.Color c, double specularShininess, double degreeOfReflectivity)
          Constructor for a specular and reflecting material.

          Scales a color by a given factor.

          Shades the material according to the given light direction, surface normal, view direction and light source intensity.

Material

public Material(java.awt.Color c,
                double specularShininess,
                double degreeOfReflectivity)
Constructor for a specular and reflecting material.

Parameters:
c - Diffuse color of the material.
specularShininess - Shininess factor for the specular highlight, according to the Blinn√êPhong shading model.
degreeOfReflectivity - degree of reflectivity in the range of [0, 1], where 1 is a perfect mirror.

Scales a color by a given factor.

Parameters:

shadeAmbient

public java.awt.Color shadeAmbient(double intensity)
Applies ambient shading with the given light source intensity.

Parameters:
intensity - Intensity of the ambient light source.
Returns:
Color that is the result of the illumination.

shade

public java.awt.Color shade(Vector3d lightDir,
                            Vector3d normal,
                            Vector3d viewDir,
                            double intensity)
Shades the material according to the given light direction, surface normal, view direction and light source intensity.

Parameters:
lightDir - Light direction to the position to be shaded.
normal - Surface normal at the position to be shaded.
viewDir - View direction to the position to be shaded.
intensity - Intensity of the light for shading the material.
Returns:
Shaded color.

getReflectanceVector

public Ray getReflectanceVector(Intersection i)
Computes the reflectance vector of the intersecting ray at the point of intersection.

Returns:
Reflected vector of the ray at the point of intersection.

getReflectivity

public double getReflectivity(Intersection i)
Computes the reflectivity at the given intersection. In this simple Material, the reflectivity is independent of the viewing direction.

Returns:
Reflectivity at the given intersection.
